      • listFiles

        public static java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> listFiles(java.io.File directory)
        Returns an iterable that can be used to navigate all the files in a directory. The listed files include sub-directories.

        Implementers note:
        Might be used to optimize file listing for Java 1.7. Alternatively, perhaps some native calls will do the job. The goal is providing faster directory listing than the default File.listFiles() method can offer.
        Parameters:
        directory - to list the file contents of
        Returns:
        Iterable of Files available in the directory

      • getFileSize

        public static long getFileSize(java.io.File file)
        Gets the amount of bytes of data stored on disk by a specific file or in a specific folder
        Parameters:
        file - to get the size of
        Returns:
        File/folder size in bytes

      • deleteFile

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> deleteFile(java.io.File file)
        Deletes a file or directory. This method will attempt to delete all files in a directory if a directory is specified. All files it could not delete will be returned. If the returned list is empty then deletion was successful. The returned list is unmodifiable.
        Parameters:
        file - to delete
        Returns:
        a list of files it could not delete

      • createOutputStream

        public static java.io.FileOutputStream createOutputStream(java.io.File file)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                          java.lang.SecurityException
        Creates a new FileOutputStream to a file. If the file does not yet exist a new file is created. The contents of existing files will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        file - to open
        Returns:
        a new FileOutputStream for the (created) file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case opening the file failed
        java.lang.SecurityException - in case the Security Manager (if assigned) denies access

      • createOutputStream

        public static java.io.FileOutputStream createOutputStream(java.io.File file,
                                                          boolean append)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                          java.lang.SecurityException
        Creates a new FileOutputStream to a file. If the file does not yet exist a new file is created.
        Parameters:
        file - to open
        append - whether to append to existing files or not
        Returns:
        a new FileOutputStream for the (created) file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case opening the file failed
        java.lang.SecurityException - in case the Security Manager (if assigned) denies access

      • tryCopyFile

        public static boolean tryCopyFile(java.io.File sourceLocation,
                                  java.io.File targetLocation)
        Tries to copy a file or directory from one place to the other. If copying fails along the way the error is printed and false is returned. Note that when copying directories it may result in an incomplete copy.
        Parameters:
        sourceLocation -
        targetLocation -
        Returns:
        True if copying succeeded, False if not

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(java.io.File sourceLocation,
                            java.io.File targetLocation)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a file or directory from one place to the other. If copying fails along the way an IOException is thrown. Note that when copying directories it may result in an incomplete copy.
        Parameters:
        sourceLocation -
        targetLocation -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileIgnoreCase

        public static java.io.File getFileIgnoreCase(java.io.File parent,
                                             java.lang.String child)
        Obtains a file found in a parent directory. Child name casing is ignored. If the child file is found in the parent directory with the same casing, this is returned. If this is not the case, but a file with the same name but different casing is available, then this is returned instead. If none could be found, a file with the casing of the child is returned alternatively.

        The returned File will point to an existing file on the current OS, if system-independent file paths are needed or paths with accurate File System casing, File.getCanonicalFile() should be used on the resulting File.
        Parameters:
        parent - directory
        child - file name
        Returns:
        File pointing to the child file found in the parent directory
